element.name: Elderheart
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Rooted in the ancient growth of the world, these Wardens are linked to a primordial untamed aspect of the world. Their vines lash and bind, inexorably dragging their enemies to the conclusion of their place in the natural cycle of life and death.

element.name: Lashing Vines
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Starting at 1st level, when you roll initiative, or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest lashing vines to wield as natural weapons. You can manifest them in one or both hands. The vines last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative, or as a bonus action at any time, you can manifest lashing vines to wield as natural weapons. You can manifest them in one or both hands. The vines last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.

element.name: Lashing Vine
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: A natural one handed melee weapon. Deals 1d6 slashing damage on hit, and has the Light, Reach, and Special Properties.
Special: This weapon has the following benefits:

ul.li: Grappling Weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can attempt to initiate a grapple against that creature as a bonus action. If you are grappling a creature with it, you can only use it to attack the creature it is grappling.

Restraining Vines. You can make a grapple check with this weapon targeting a Large or smaller creature you are currently grappling with it. On success, the creature is restrained while grappled this way.

Reaching Grapples. You can grapple creatures with this weapon with a reach equal to the weapon’s reach. If a creature more than 5 feet away from you is grappled or restrained by you with this weapon their movement is not reduced to zero, but they can only move toward you. Once they are within 5 feet of you, their movement speed becomes zero.

Grappling Larger Creatures. You can attempt to grapple creatures up to two sizes larger than you when initiating a grapple with this weapon, but creatures two sizes larger than you have their movement speed reduced by half, rather than reduced to zero. If they move out of range of your grapple, you can choose to release them, or be pulled along with their movement.

sheet.description: A natural one handed melee weapon. Deals 1d6 slashing damage on hit, and has the Light, Reach, and Special Properties. Grappling Weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can attempt to initiate a grapple against that creature as a bonus action. If you are grappling a creature with it, you can only use it to attack the creature it is grappling. Restraining Vines. You can make a grapple check with this weapon targeting a Large or smaller creature you are currently grappling with it. On success, the creature is restrained while grappled this way. Reaching Grapples. You can grapple creatures with this weapon with a reach equal to the weapon’s reach. If a creature more than 5 feet away from you is grappled or restrained by you with this weapon their movement is not reduced to zero, but they can only move toward you. Once they are within 5 feet of you, their movement speed becomes zero. Grappling Larger Creatures. You can attempt to grapple creatures up to two sizes larger than you when initiating a grapple with this weapon, but creatures two sizes larger than you have their movement speed reduced by half, rather than reduced to zero. If they move out of range of your grapple, you can choose to release them, or be pulled along with their movement.

element.name: Eyes of Nature
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: At 1st level, you gain advantage on Nature or Survival checks that involve plants (to identify them, to tell if they are edible, or track things that have passed through them, etc.).

sheet.description: You gain advantage on Nature or Survival checks that involve plants (to identify them, to tell if they are edible, or track things that have passed through them, etc.).

element.name: Innate Magic
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

sheet.description: You can cast each spell once without components or spell slots. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You can cast a spell again before completing a long rest by spending 1 + the level of the spell Endurance Dice.

element.name: Body of Thorns
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies
